name: Gustav Holst Way (Cranham Church to Crickley Hill)

ai.summary: A challenging 18.4 km hike along the Gustav Holst Way from Cranham Church to Crickley Hill. Starting in a rural setting, the route climbs across chalk downland and quiet lanes to the Crickley Hill ridge, ending with expansive views over the surrounding countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surfaces including chalk paths, grassy slopes, rocky sections, and rural lanes. Expect steep ascents and exposed ridge walking near Crickley Hill, with mud in wetter conditions and some woodland segments.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard route with potential exposure on the Crickley Hill ridge. Plan for a full-day hike, check weather forecasts, and bring extra layers. Carry enough water and food, a map or GPS, and a means to navigate. Be mindful of farm traffic on lanes and ensure someone knows your route and expected return time. Footing can be uneven; watch for mud, loose stones, and low winter light.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Water and high-energy snacks (2–3 liters depending on conditions)
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproof outer shell, hat)
Map and/or GPS device (plus compass as backup)
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish or detours)
Walking poles (optional but helpful on steep sections)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October); can be done in winter with proper gear, but visibility and footing can be challenging.

seo.title: Gustav Holst Way: Cranham Church to Crickley Hill – 18.4 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover a challenging 18.4 km hike along the Gustav Holst Way from Cranham Church to Crickley Hill. Learn about terrain, safety, and the gear you need for this UK countryside route.
